column4: Hey guys, I just(finally!) got Ubuntu installed(after having to use Breezy, then update, then...all sorts of workarounds)... I have a kernel that locks up(it has a 15 at the end), but I had one with 12 at the end as an option in GRUB..How do I remove the 15 one?
what kind of processor do you have?
you'll want to use Synaptic to install the latest K7 kernel image, and then use Synaptic to remove the other kernels and their modules.
